introduction.p: To graph a conic section, we complete the square in each variable to put the equation in standard form.
Points on the graph of a conic section satisfy a quadratic equation in two variables.

statement.p: Find all points on the graph of x^2+y^2 = 12 with x-coordinate 2.

solution.p: We substitute x=2 into the equation to obtain 2^2+y^2=12 and simplify to y^2=8. Solving for y, we find y=\pm \sqrt{8} = \pm 2\sqrt{2}. Thus, the points on the graph of x^2+y^2 = 12 with x-coordinate 2 are (2, 2\sqrt{2}) and (2, -2\sqrt{2}).

statement.p: Find all points on the graph of y=2x^2-4x+3 with y-coordinate 3.
Find all points on the graph of (x-4)^2+(y+1)^2=25 with y-coordinate 3.
